description: A renowned cultural venue showcasing traditional Vietnamese water puppetry, an art form dating back to the Ly Dynasty in the Red River Delta. Established in 1969, the theatre performs over 500 shows annually for 150,000+ visitors. Recognized by Asia Book of Records as the only theatre performing every day of the year, it combines live traditional music, colorful wooden puppets, and water stage to tell Vietnamese folklore and historical tales.
highlights: 50-60 minute shows featuring Vietnamese folktales and history
Skilled puppeteers controlling wooden puppets from behind bamboo screen
Live traditional instruments: Erhu, Flute, Zither, Monochord
Visual effects: fireworks, water splashes, smoke, laser lighting
Stories featuring dragons, martial arts, fishing, buffalo riding
Ancient art form from the Red River Delta region
Daily performances recognized by Asia Book of Records
Located steps from Hoan Kiem Lake
tips: Book tickets in advance for best seating
Rent audio guide for small fee to understand storylines and background
Located at 57B Dinh Tien Hoang Street, near Hoan Kiem Lake

vibe: Magical and enchanting, the water puppet show transports audiences into Vietnam's ancient folklore. The splash of water mingles with traditional music as wooden dragons dance and fishermen cast their nets. Puppeteers hidden behind bamboo screens bring centuries-old stories to life with remarkable skill. The intimate theatre fills with wonder as mythical creatures emerge from the water, making this uniquely Vietnamese art form unforgettable for all ages.
